intro: Hapalostephium alpestre, commonly known as the alpine larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are compound, with lance-shaped leaflets, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. Hapalostephium alpestre is often found at high altitudes, where it plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its habitat.
